00019 /**
00020 @page linuxdebugger Linux Userspace Debugging
00021 
00022 The Linux User Space Debugger @b gdb is part of the minimial root file system,
00023 located under /usr/bin directory.
00024 
00025 Please refer to http://sources.redhat.com/gdb/current/onlinedocs/gdb_toc.html
00026 for a list of debugger commands and options.
00027 
00028 <h2>Debugging an application using Linux Native Debugger</h2>
00029 
00030     To build an application to debug, use OCTEON Linux cross compiler
00031     (mips64-octeon-linux-gnu-gcc) to compile on the host, adding the "-g" flag
00032     to the compilation command line.
00033 
00034     Here is an example how to debug low-latency-mem example from
00035     OCTEON-SDK/examples directory. By default, the low-latency-mem-linux
00036     example is stripped of debugging information, rebuild it before attempting
00037     to debug it.
00038 
00039 @verbatim
00040     # gdb low-latency-mem-linux
00041     GNU gdb 6.3
00042     Copyright 2004 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
00043     GDB is free software, covered by the GNU General Public License, and you are
00044     welcome to change it and/or distribute copies of it under certain conditions.
00045     Type "show copying" to see the conditions.
00046     There is absolutely no warranty for GDB.  Type "show warranty" for details.
00047     This GDB was configured as "mips64-octeon-linux-gnu"...Using host libthread_db library "/lib64/libthread_db.so.1".
00048 
00049     (gdb) break appmain
00050     Breakpoint 1 at 0x120005840: file low-latency-mem.c, line 521.
00051     (gdb) run
00052     Starting program: /examples/low-latency-mem-linux
00053     CVMX_SHARED: 0x120180000-0x120182000
00054     Active coremask = 0x1
00055 
00056     Breakpoint 1, appmain () at low-latency-mem.c:521
00057     521         const char *names[] = {"add_slow", "add_fast", "add_slow", "add_fast",
00058     (gdb) next
00059     523         const int   replication[] = {CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, REPLICATION_CODE, REPLI,(gdb)
00060     533         cvmx_user_app_init();
00061     (gdb) next
00062     535         sysinfo = cvmx_sysinfo_get();
00063     (gdb) next
00064     536         core_mask = sysinfo->core_mask;
00065     (gdb) next
00066     537         CVMX_POP(num_cores, core_mask);
00067     (gdb) p core_mask
00068     $1 = 1
00069     (gdb) next
00070     541         if (cvmx_coremask_first_core(core_mask))
00071     (gdb) break do_tests
00072     Breakpoint 2 at 0x120004c5c: file low-latency-mem.c, line 445.
00073     (gdb) continue
00074     Continuing.
00075     clock mult: 12, LLM ONE PORT
00076     Initializing Low latency Memory
00077     Initialization Complete
00078 
00079     Breakpoint 2, do_tests (core_mask=1, totals=0xfffffffa90, cycles=0xfffffffad0)
00080         at low-latency-mem.c:445
00081     445         CVMX_SYNC;
00082     (gdb) backtrace
00083     #0  do_tests (core_mask=1, totals=0xfffffffa90, cycles=0xfffffffad0)
00084         at low-latency-mem.c:445
00085     #1  0x000000012000598c in appmain () at low-latency-mem.c:547
00086     #2  0x00000001200065f0 in main (argc=1, argv=0xfffffffdd8)
00087         at /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive/cvmx-app-init-linux.c:292
00088     (gdb) next
00089     447         do_wait(core_mask);
00090     (gdb) run
00091     The program being debugged has been started already.
00092     Start it from the beginning? (y or n) y
00093 
00094     Starting program: /examples/low-latency-mem-linux
00095     CVMX_SHARED: 0x120180000-0x120182000
00096     Active coremask = 0x1
00097 
00098     Breakpoint 1, appmain () at low-latency-mem.c:521
00099     521         const char *names[] = {"add_slow", "add_fast", "add_slow", "add_fast",
00100     (gdb) n
00101     523         const int   replication[] = {CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, REPLICATION_CODE, REPLI,(gdb)
00102     533         cvmx_user_app_init();
00103     (gdb) n
00104     535         sysinfo = cvmx_sysinfo_get();
00105     (gdb) step
00106     cvmx_sysinfo_get ()
00107         at /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive/cvmx-sysinfo.c:77
00108     77      /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive/cvmx-sysinfo.c: No such file or directory.
00109             in /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive/cvmx-sysinfo.c
00110     (gdb)
00111 @endverbatim
00112 
00113     Please note that the first breakpoint is at "appmain" not at "main". The simple
00114     executive applications start at appmain() under Linux.
00115 
00116     When the application was built on the host, the simple executive sources were
00117     located at /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive directory.  While
00118     debugging and stepping into cvmx_sysinfo_get(), the debugger will look for the
00119     same path and likely not find the source code.  One may use the 'dir' gdb command
00120     to tell the debugger to look at an alternate location for the source code.
00121 
00122 <h2>Using hardware watchpoints with the Linux Native Debugger</h2>
00123 
00124     The Linux Native Debugger on OCTEON Linux supports a single
00125     hardware backed watchpoint.  It can be used to find where a
00126     program variable is being modified.
00127 
00128     Here is an example of using a hardware watchpoints. Note that the
00129     strcpy() on line 20 clobbers the other fields in the structure.
00130 
00131 @verbatim
00132     # gdb watchtest1
00133     GNU gdb 6.8 Cavium Inc. Development Build
00134     Copyright (C) 2008 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
00135     License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
00136     This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
00137     There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
00138     and "show warranty" for details.
00139     This GDB was configured as "mips64-octeon-linux-gnu"...
00140     (gdb) l 1,26
00141     1   #include <stdio.h>
00142     2   #include <string.h>
00143     3
00144     4   struct bar {
00145     5     char name[16];
00146     6     int f1;
00147     7     int f2;
00148     8   };
00149     9
00150     10  const char *val = "This name is too long";
00151     11
00152     12  int main(int argc, char **argv)
00153     13  {
00154     14    struct bar s;
00155     15
00156     16    s.f1 = 3;
00157     17    s.f2 = 10;
00158     18    printf("s.f1: %d, s.f2: %d\n", s.f1, s.f2);
00159     19
00160     20    strcpy(s.name, val);
00161     21
00162     22    printf("s.f1: %d, s.f2: %d\n", s.f1, s.f2);
00163     23
00164     24    return 0;
00165     25  }
00166     (gdb) b 17
00167     Breakpoint 1 at 0x1200009a8: file watchtest1.c, line 17.
00168     (gdb) run
00169     Starting program: /mnt/watchtest1
00170 
00171     Breakpoint 1, main (argc=1, argv=0xffffcb0298) at watchtest1.c:17
00172     17    s.f2 = 10;
00173     (gdb) watch s.f1
00174     Hardware watchpoint 2: s.f1
00175     (gdb) c
00176     Continuing.
00177     s.f1: 3, s.f2: 10
00178     Hardware watchpoint 2: s.f1
00179 
00180     Old value = 3
00181     New value = 536870915
00182     0x00000055556214d0 in strcpy () from /lib64/libc.so.6
00183     (gdb) bt
00184     #0  0x00000055556214d0 in strcpy () from /lib64/libc.so.6
00185     #1  0x00000001200009ec in main (argc=1, argv=0xffffcb0298) at watchtest1.c:20
00186     (gdb)
00187 @endverbatim
00188 
00189 <h2>Debugging an application using Linux Native gdbserver</h2>
00190 
00191     Applications can also be debugged using the Linux cross debugger. The host
00192     machine runs mips64-octeon-linux-gnu-gdb and OCTEON runs gdbserver.
00193 
00194     Here is an example how to debug the low-latency-memory example. Build the
00195     low-latency-memory example with debugging symbols by passing the
00196     <b>"-g"</b> option.
00197 
00198     On OCTEON (running Linux) invoke:
00199 
00200     @note When using Debian root file system, add to the PATH environment
00201     variable /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/tools/usr/bin to
00202     pick the correct gdbserver for debugging n64 ABI application.
00203 
00204 @verbatim
00205     # export PATH=/usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/tools/usr/bin:$PATH
00206 @endverbatim
00207 
00208     @note In the gdbserver command "2349" is a tcp port number. Later gdb will
00209         connect to this port from the host.
00210 
00211 @verbatim
00212     # gdbserver :2349 low-latency-memory-linux_64
00213     Process ./low-latency-mem-linux_64 created; pid = 891
00214     Listening on port 2349
00215 @endverbatim
00216 
00217     And on your host:
00218 
00219     @note "192.168.16.61:2349" in "target remote" is the IP address of OCTEON,
00220         followed by the gdbserver port number (from above).
00221 
00222 @verbatim
00223     $ mips64-octeon-linux-gnu-gdb low-latency-memoy-linux_64
00224 
00225     GNU gdb 6.3
00226     Copyright 2004 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
00227     GDB is free software, covered by the GNU General Public License, and you are
00228     welcome to change it and/or distribute copies of it under certain conditions.
00229     Type "show copying" to see the conditions.
00230     There is absolutely no warranty for GDB.  Type "show warranty" for details.
00231     This GDB was configured as "--host=i686-pc-linux-gnu --target=mips64-octeon-linux-gnu"...
00232     (gdb) target remote 192.168.16.61:2349
00233     Remote debugging using 192.168.16.61:2349
00234     0x0000000120003620 in _ftext ()
00235 @endverbatim
00236 
00237     Once a connection is made, gdbserver will display an acknowledgement message:
00238 
00239 @verbatim
00240     Remote debugging from host 192.168.16.30
00241 @endverbatim
00242 
00243     Continue debugging the program:
00244 
00245 @verbatim
00246     (gdb) b appmain
00247     Breakpoint 1 at 0x120005168: file low-latency-mem.c, line 521.
00248     (gdb) c
00249     Continuing.
00250 
00251     Breakpoint 1, appmain () at low-latency-mem.c:521
00252     521         const char *names[] = {"add_slow", "add_fast", "add_slow", "add_fast",
00253     (gdb) next
00254     523         const int   replication[] = {CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE, REPLICATION_CODE, REPLICATION_CODE2,
00255     (gdb) next
00256     533         cvmx_user_app_init();
00257     (gdb) next
00258     535         sysinfo = cvmx_sysinfo_get();
00259     (gdb) next
00260     536         core_mask = sysinfo->core_mask;
00261     (gdb) next
00262     537         CVMX_POP(num_cores, core_mask);
00263     (gdb) p core_mask
00264     $1 = 1
00265     (gdb) next
00266     541         if (cvmx_coremask_first_core(core_mask))
00267     (gdb) b do_tests
00268     Breakpoint 2 at 0x120004584: file low-latency-mem.c, line 445.
00269     (gdb) c
00270     Continuing.
00271 
00272     Breakpoint 2, do_tests (core_mask=1, totals=0xffffe688d0, cycles=0xffffe68910)
00273         at low-latency-mem.c:445
00274     445         CVMX_SYNC;
00275     (gdb) backtrace
00276     #0  do_tests (core_mask=1, totals=0xffffe688d0, cycles=0xffffe68910) at low-latency-mem.c:445
00277     #1  0x00000001200052b4 in appmain () at low-latency-mem.c:547
00278     #2  0x00000001200067e0 in main (argc=1, argv=0xffffe68c98)
00279         at /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/executive/cvmx-app-init-linux.c:384
00280     (gdb) next
00281     447         do_wait(core_mask);
00282     (gdb) continue
00283     Continuing.
00284 
00285     Program exited normally.
00286     (gdb) quit
00287 @endverbatim
00288 
00289     Output from the application will show up on OCTEON:
00290 
00291 @verbatim
00292     CVMX_SHARED: 0x120190000-0x120192000
00293     Active coremask = 0x1
00294     Configuring 1 llm port.
00295     Initializing Low latency Memory
00296     Initialization Complete
00297     Core  0: add_slow   1x sum = 523776 in  69399 cycles
00298     Core  0: add_fast   1x sum = 523776 in  34776 cycles
00299     Core  0: add_slow   2x sum = 523776 in  65702 cycles
00300     Core  0: add_fast   8x sum = 523776 in  34416 cycles
00301     Core  0: add_slow64 1x sum = 523776 in  34304 cycles
00302     Core  0: add_fast64 1x sum = 523776 in  17451 cycles
00303     Core  0: add_slow64 2x sum = 523776 in  34277 cycles
00304     Core  0: add_fast64 8x sum = 523776 in  17258 cycles
00305 
00306     Average: add_slow   1x =  69399 cycles
00307     Average: add_fast   1x =  34776 cycles
00308     Average: add_slow   2x =  65702 cycles
00309     Average: add_fast   8x =  34416 cycles
00310     Average: add_slow64 1x =  34304 cycles
00311     Average: add_fast64 1x =  17451 cycles
00312     Average: add_slow64 2x =  34277 cycles
00313     Average: add_fast64 8x =  17258 cycles
00314 
00315     TEST PASSED
00316 
00317     Child exited with retcode = 0
00318 
00319     Child exited with status 0
00320     GDBserver exiting
00321 @endverbatim
00322 
00323 
00324 <h2>GDB Server over a Serial Line</h2>
00325 
00326     To debug the application over a serial port, you need to enable the second
00327     serial port as mentioned in @ref linux and rebuild the Linux Kernel.
00328     Invoke gdbserver by specifying the serial device (/dev/ttyS1) and pass
00329     serial device to "target remote" command instead of an IP address and port
00330     number.
00331 
00332 @verbatim
00333     gdbserver /dev/ttyS1 low-latency-memory-linux_64
00334 @endverbatim
00335 
00336 @verbatim
00337     mips64-octeon-linux-gnu-gdb low-latency-memory-linux_64
00338     GNU gdb 6.3
00339     Copyright 2004 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
00340     GDB is free software, covered by the GNU General Public License, and you are
00341     welcome to change it and/or distribute copies of it under certain conditions.
00342     Type "show copying" to see the conditions.
00343     There is absolutely no warranty for GDB.  Type "show warranty" for details.
00344     This GDB was configured as "--host=i686-pc-linux-gnu --target=mips64-octeon-linux-gnu"...
00345     (gdb) set remotebaud 9600
00346     (gdb) target remote /dev/ttyUSB1
00347 @endverbatim
00348 
00349 <h2>Known Issues</h2>
00350     -# The debugger does not show the correct value for "long double" variables.
00351 
00352 */
